sub_title: Insightful ally for choices connecting to meaning | Facilitating transformations | Book Your Session: calendly.com/giovanna-manto
summary:
In my early career, I worked as an industrial engineer for large multinational corporations in both technical and strategic roles, gaining a multi-faceted exposure to the complexity of organizations and a thorough grasp of the socio-systemic dynamics that executives face in culturally diverse teams and uncertain business contexts. 

Throughout the years, this development has fueled my passion to facilitate transformational leadership with unconditional regard and a thought-provoking style, naturally taking me to co-create with high-impact decision-makers who want to shift dysfunctional belief systems and narratives into expanded perspectives in service of growth.  

Italian by origin, I now live in Amsterdam, after a number of relocations in UK and US first, and throughout Europe subsequently with my family. Trained with the Co-Active Training Institute (CTI), I’m now prepping to become a Master Coach, working from my Professional Coach Certification with the International Coach Federation (ICF). 
I hold with distinction an Executive Master in clinical organizational psychology from INSEAD and a series of other useful practitioner tools accreditations, such as the Leadership Circle 360 Profile, the Hogan assessment and the Scrum Agile coaching, currently expanding my edges with meaningful spiritual work (Gita Belin, Aberkyn-McKinsey) and a certification as a Vinyasa Yoga teacher. 

In my free time, I love giving back to my community, coaching a volleyball team of young talented girls and volunteering as a transition dialogues facilitator at the international school of my children. I also enjoy playing marimbas in a local music group and sporting in nature with my beloved family and dog.

projects.title: Workshop: Free yourself from the traps of the mind - Make choice from a place of freedom. @INTERNATIONS
projects.description:
“It is not our abilities that show what we truly are. It is our choices.” Albus Dumbledore
Imagine you are watching an action movie. At one point, the character you feel drawn to gets trapped in a small room with no way out and little time to save her life and the lives of many others. How do you feel about her? How would you wish she could find an escape and free up herself and the others? 
Now imagine you have figured a way out but the character in the movie is still struggling with little hope to find her way out. You may think to yourself excitedly: ‘come on look up this way dude: that’s were you are going to be free, for heavens’ sake’. How would you like that this movie character could hear you and see what you can see? 
More often than we’d like to admit to ourselves, we may have the feeling to be that character in the movie, while our ‘hindsight-self’ the person having it all figured out but with little or no use. To our disbelief, the same scene repeats itself with no variation, just like a movie is the same movie when it gets played again. 
In our experiential workshop you will be offered a safe space where to explore your own small rooms where your mind gets typically caught. You will then learn how to break the circular triggering thoughts and affirm your freedom to make more conscious and resourceful choices you can make when outside of the movie you don’t want to play anymore.

projects.title: Workshop: CLEAR™ to boost confidence in handling conflicts at work - Grooa.com
projects.description:
➢	Sustainable efficiency: learn to invest in an open dialogue upfront, minimize reworks, smoothen the path, and save time and energy in the end
➢	Improved decision making: learn to invite new ideas and alternative perspectives and challenge usual paths thus minimizing risks as well as stimulating innovation
➢	Improved effectiveness and alignment: learn to build more effective, self-directed and aligned teams
➢	Influence and impact: learn to ask the critical questions, be transparent, and clarify intentions; inspire others by example
➢	Reduced stress, increased confidence: gain the peace of mind and confidence that will make you enjoy the open dialogue and benefit from it 
➢	Innovation and positive change: develop the curiosity to explore, the ability to provoke and the courage to challenge, in order to stimulate innovative approaches 
➢	Stronger relationships – learn to create engagement, trust and mutual enjoyment in the collaboration

projects.title: Workshop: "Embrace change. Design the life you want". Project in fulfilment of the CTI Leadership Program Requirements for Graduation
projects.description:
Fulfillment is intensely personal and it constantly evolves in the face of continuous changes that we go through in our day-to-day lives. Embracing change is the pathway to a happier and more fulfilled life. 

Fulfillment starts with knowing what our values are and making conscious and resonant choices. In this workshop you will receive hands-on tools and practical insights about creating the life you want. 

Most of us, international globetrotting expatriates partners, go through the roller coasters of change and cope daily with the challenges of new environments.

Knowing how to embrace change can significantly enhance our quality of life.

profile_positions.title: Facilitator for Transformation | Co-founder of Healthy Change Partners

profile_positions.description:
https://www.thnk.org/community/people/giovanna-manto/

THNK’s mission is to identify, support, groom and foster creative leaders, and to realise innovative solutions to societal challenges. It's vision is to build a community of social change agents, entrepreneurs, and innovation managers – connected and engaged through Creative Leadership Programs, social change efforts, scale-up efforts and in-company programs.

Dubbed by Stanford University as “the future of higher education”, THNK stands for creativity, business model innovation, and entrepreneurship for social impact. While a ‘B-School’ professionalizes management and a ‘D-School’ does the same for product design, THNK is a ‘C-School’ that applies creativity for positive change at scale. 

Participants include experienced corporate innovators, entrepreneurs, and social change agents from all over the world with executive-level or entrepreneurial work experience. Each class consists of 40 people with around 20 different nationalities, men and women equally split.

THNK combines business design thinking with innovation strategy, and leadership development with the nurturing of entrepreneurial mindsets, with an emphasis on doing social good.

THNK’s Creative Leadership Program is fully focused on learning-by-doing. Instead of lectures and academic study cases, THNK spurs its participants to work together on business and social concepts and open innovation projects to discover new avenues of perspective and potential
